about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign?

about.name: What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign?

hasPart.assesses: What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign? | What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "stop." You must always come to a complete stop at this sign.

comment.text: Do not enter.
One-way.
Stop.
Stop.

answerExplanation.text: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "stop." You must always come to a complete stop at this sign.

comment.text: What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign? | An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "stop." You must always come to a complete stop at this sign.

hasPart.name: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:

about.name: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:

hasPart.assesses: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles: | A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken yellow line next to your driving lane means that you may pass.

suggestedAnswer.text: Driving in both directions may pass.

comment.text: Driving in both directions may pass.

suggestedAnswer.text: Next to the broken line may pass.

comment.text: Next to the broken line may pass.

suggestedAnswer.text: Next to the solid line may pass.

comment.text: Next to the solid line may pass.

acceptedAnswer.text: Next to the broken line may pass.

comment.text: Next to the broken line may pass.

answerExplanation.text: Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken yellow line next to your driving lane means that you may pass.

comment.text: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles: | Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken yellow line next to your driving lane means that you may pass.

hasPart.name: You are driving on a one-way street. You may only turn left onto another one-way street if:

about.name: You are driving on a one-way street. You may only turn left onto another one-way street if:

hasPart.assesses: You are driving on a one-way street. You may only turn left onto another one-way street if: | You are driving on a one-way street. You may only turn left onto another one-way street if: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may turn left onto a one-way street that moves to the left if there is no sign prohibiting the turn. You may not turn left onto a one-way street where traffic moves to the right.

suggestedAnswer.text: You increase your speed before the turn.

comment.text: You increase your speed before the turn.

suggestedAnswer.text: Traffic on the street moves to the right.

comment.text: Traffic on the street moves to the right.

suggestedAnswer.text: Traffic on the street moves to the left.

comment.text: Traffic on the street moves to the left.

acceptedAnswer.text: Traffic on the street moves to the left.

comment.text: Traffic on the street moves to the left.

answerExplanation.text: You may turn left onto a one-way street that moves to the left if there is no sign prohibiting the turn. You may not turn left onto a one-way street where traffic moves to the right.

comment.text: You are driving on a one-way street. You may only turn left onto another one-way street if: | You may turn left onto a one-way street that moves to the left if there is no sign prohibiting the turn. You may not turn left onto a one-way street where traffic moves to the right.

hasPart.name: The first thing that alcohol effects is:

about.name: The first thing that alcohol effects is:

hasPart.assesses: The first thing that alcohol effects is: | The first thing that alcohol effects is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Alcohol reduces all of the important abilities you need to drive safely. Alcohol goes from your stomach to your blood, then from your blood to all other parts of your body. Alcohol affects the areas of your brain that control judgment and skill.

comment.text: Vision.
Judgment.
Balance.
Judgment.

answerExplanation.text: Alcohol reduces all of the important abilities you need to drive safely. Alcohol goes from your stomach to your blood, then from your blood to all other parts of your body. Alcohol affects the areas of your brain that control judgment and skill.

comment.text: The first thing that alcohol effects is: | Alcohol reduces all of the important abilities you need to drive safely. Alcohol goes from your stomach to your blood, then from your blood to all other parts of your body. Alcohol affects the areas of your brain that control judgment and skill.

hasPart.name: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should:

about.name: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should:

hasPart.assesses: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should: | A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: At a green light, you must give the right-of-way to any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian in the intersection. If a pedestrian begins crossing the street after the traffic signal light starts flashing, wait until they have crossed the street before proceeding.

suggestedAnswer.text: Proceed if you have the right-of-way.

comment.text: Proceed if you have the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Proceed if the pedestrian is not in your lane.

comment.text: Proceed if the pedestrian is not in your lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

comment.text: Wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

acceptedAnswer.text: Wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

comment.text: Wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

answerExplanation.text: At a green light, you must give the right-of-way to any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian in the intersection. If a pedestrian begins crossing the street after the traffic signal light starts flashing, wait until they have crossed the street before proceeding.

comment.text: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should: | At a green light, you must give the right-of-way to any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian in the intersection. If a pedestrian begins crossing the street after the traffic signal light starts flashing, wait until they have crossed the street before proceeding.
